title.rendered: Boost Leader Step 2 DQ Best form

content.rendered:
• What are the best forms of motivation: recognition awards, a strong sense of teamwork, uniting around a common cause, or a combination of things?

  • What are you doing when you are the most motivated, and what are you doing when you are the least motivated?
  • What specific outcomes will let you know your leaders are more motivated?
  • Do you know what you want motivated people to do as far as motivating their teams, enrolling new people, increasing volume, learning new things, and becoming better leaders?
  • Do you tell achievement stories to inform and inspire people about the success of others?
  • What mental and emotional qualities do you want highly motivated leaders to display?
  • When you communicate with others, do you also communicate excitement and explain how improved effort on their part will achieve imagined success?

content.rendered:
Social Security Numbers

Resolve Concerns About Social Security Numbers

When people who want to enroll as consultants are apprehensive about listing their social security number:

  • Resolve concerns. Resolve concerns by wording your statement so people recognize it is simply a requirement of the IRS.
  • Be honest. Make statements honestly and confidently to convey conviction and integrity—you are simply guiding them through the buying process.
  • Use a tier system. All levels of response are wins. Present each tier, and let the person decide or respond before you present the next tier. See examples of this in the Conversation Tips below.

content.rendered:
Skepticism About Products

Authenticate the Products
  • Provide research. Introduce enough scientific research to show it is not just “your opinion.”
  • Share testimonials. Present a list of testimonials of satisfied users to show that many people know the products work. There are many testimonials available.
  • Improve your teaching. Evaluate your teaching/presentation methods to see if there are areas you can improve to communicate about the products better.
  • Offer samples. Provide samples to let people see for themselves at no risk.
  • Confirm correct application. Make sure people are using the products correctly: correct amounts, combinations, and time for results to occur.

content.rendered:
Motivating People

When Your Team Isn’t Motivated

As you build your business and become a leader, one of the greatest desires you will have is to motivate your own builders and leaders. Motivation is greatest when it comes from inside (intrinsic motivation or being self-motivated) instead of from outside influences (extrinsic, like rewards or penalties). Intrinsic motivation is one of the purest forms of empowerment and motivation.

How to Create Intrinsic Motivation

  • Build trust with people. Lead by example, be positive and supportive, and show respect for others’ thoughts and opinions. Invite participation, and use good shared ideas.
  • Identify direction. Help people find a clear direction or path to take (i.e., “I want to enroll five people this month”) so their work isn’t frozen by indecision.
  • Create strategies that support your desired direction. This is so your work is always tied to a goal and not just “keeping you busy.”
  • Create strong relationships with people who can help you execute your strategy and achieve your desired direction. Make sure these relationships are mutually beneficial, where both parties benefit in some way.
  • Improve skills necessary to accomplish what you want: contacting, finding, closing, presenting, company website tools, creative thinking, time management, etc.
  • Measure progress and duplicate what works. Measure progress regularly (at least weekly) to identify your methods that are producing good results and those that are ineffective. Duplicate what is working. Make changes to what is not working, and test these new changes to strengthen your strategies.

excerpt.rendered:
Motivating People When Your Team Isn’t Motivated As you build your business and become a leader, one of the greatest desires you will have is to motivate your own builders and leaders. Motivation is greatest when it comes from inside (intrinsic motivation or being self-motivated) instead of from outside influences (extrinsic, like rewards or penalties). …

Missed Opportunities

How to Correct Missed Opportunities
  • Build relationships with people no matter what. Don’t always focus on selling.
  • Someone might not buy this time, but he or she might in the future.
  • Make mental note of missed opportunities so you are mentally prepared to take advantage of similar situations in the future.

content.rendered:
Managing a Team

Unify Your Team and Boost Performance

Good team management is a skill set you can learn, regardless of your current experience.

  • Set a good example. You can’t take your leaders to new and better places if you aren’t willing to go there yourself.
  • Know the essentials of the business: ordering product, teaching classes, closing, enrolling people, organizing teams to hit rank goals, back office tools, available trainings and resources, etc.
  • Be consistent. People are more likely to trust and follow you when you are supportive and exhibit a steady, reliable, positive, and predictable personality.
  • Improve your skills. Show your team you are always willing to learn something new or learn how to do something better.
  • Involve others and invite participation. Strong leaders transform people and teams by developing leadership skills in those they work with. Invite participation and welcome ideas. People perform better when they feel their suggestions are appreciated and accepted.
  • Be a leader who motivates, inspires, and creates strong teamwork. Learn the six leadership innovations in the Catalyst Leadership System program in this app.

excerpt.rendered:
Managing a Team Unify Your Team and Boost Performance Good team management is a skill set you can learn, regardless of your current experience. Set a good example. You can’t take your leaders to new and better places if you aren’t willing to go there yourself. Know the essentials of the business: ordering product, teaching …

content.rendered:
Low Class Attendance

Increase Attendance and Participation at Classes
  • Organize an effective advertising schedule.
    • Advertise in advance and multiple times. For example, start two weeks out so people can plan for the class. Every 3-4 days, send out a new reminder message. Finish your schedule 2 days before the class.
    • Keep it fresh. Modify each message to keep communication fresh.
    • Emphasize the benefits. Focus on rewards, incentives, games, free gifts, samples, etc. in each new reminder.
    • Personalize reminders. Strengthen working relationships by making reminders more personal: unique to a person’s specific health needs, specific to a particular event or situation, etc.
    • Spark interest and reward pre-class participation. Tell people about rewards for anyone who watches helpful and relevant videos before coming to class. This can excite people and increase attendance. And it can help people be more informed when they attend so your classes are more productive and engaging.

 

  • Evaluate yourself. Regularly evaluate how you teach, invite, and communicate, etc., to identify areas that need improvement. People are more likely to host and refer people to your classes if they feel you are a good presenter.
    • Quality or Relevance of Information. Are you talking about products important to this group or important for this time of year, for instance?
    • Presentation. Is it valuable information? Are you persuasive enough? Can people understand what you are presenting (are you clear and easy to understand)? Is your presentation exciting or interesting? Do you feel and convey pressure, or do you appear confident and relaxed?
    • Rewards and Incentives. How can you improve your use of rewards for attendance, participation, or for new hosts?
  • Follow up to collect feedback. Feedback can help you identify areas you can improve, but it also is a powerful tool to create strong relationships that can turn “no” into “yes.” Collecting feedback is not the time to be defensive or discouraged—it is a strong business practice that can help you produce positive improvements.

excerpt.rendered:
Low Class Attendance Increase Attendance and Participation at Classes Organize an effective advertising schedule. Advertise in advance and multiple times. For example, start two weeks out so people can plan for the class. Every 3-4 days, send out a new reminder message. Finish your schedule 2 days before the class. Keep it fresh. Modify each …

content.rendered:
Leaders Are Avoiding Me

Create Strong Working Relationships
  • Build trust. If your leaders seem to be avoiding you or seem unmotivated, you may need to develop greater trust.
    • Be consistent, reliable, and emotionally steady.
    • Build your capacity by improving and learning new things so you are sharing beneficial information and techniques. Lead by example.
    • Communicate better so you are all on the same page.
    • Involve others and accept their good ideas in planning strategies.
    • See mistakes as opportunities to learn and improve, not blame or get down on yourself.
  • Establish clear and mutually understood expectations. Your builders may feel overwhelmed or like you are pushing too much. Match performance with their desired level of commitment so they are not overwhelmed and you know how to best help them. Explain the levels of participation (time involved, money earned, etc.) so they understand what the expectations are. Then support them with whichever level they select. Three common levels of participation are:
    • People just want to share product to earn enough to pay for their personal use of the products.
    • People want to make a little extra money.
    • People want to generate full-time income.

excerpt.rendered:
Leaders Are Avoiding Me Create Strong Working Relationships Build trust. If your leaders seem to be avoiding you or seem unmotivated, you may need to develop greater trust. content.rendered:
Incentives

Smart Ways to Use Incentives
  • Reward long-term accomplishments. Get more out of incentives by linking them to acts that grow your team over the long term instead of just a one-month volume goal, for example.WHAT TO INCENTIVIZE
    NOT: matching end-of-month product purchases
    BUT: signing someone up on the loyalty programNOT: making one sale
    BUT: enrolling a new consultant

    NOT: incentivizing one referral
    BUT: hosting a class

  • Offer class rewards. Games, contests, or incentives for class attendance or participation are great ideas because classes are a primary source of leads, volume, and new consultants, so take advantage of this great face-to-face opportunity.

content.rendered:
Frustrated with New Enrollees

Eliminate Frustration by Communicating Better

You might have new enrollees on your team who are underperforming, asking too many questions, avoiding you, or not following through. Be patient, and treat others with respect. You were new once too.

  • Make sure you and new enrollees are on the same page. If you are thinking differently or have different expectations or goals, for instance, it is easy to become confused and frustrated. Communicate until everyone understands. Listen, welcome suggestions, and clarify, if necessary.

 

  • Delegate. Ask “will you” questions when organizing assignments instead of leaving it open for people to answer or not.

 

  • Provide clear and simple directions. People are often slow to perform, or they underperform when they are not sure what to do or how to do it. Start with manageable tasks, and increase them as people’s experience and expertise increase.

excerpt.rendered:
Frustrated with New Enrollees Eliminate Frustration by Communicating Better You might have new enrollees on your team who are underperforming, asking too many questions, avoiding you, or not following through. content.rendered:
Finding Builders

How to Grow Your Team
  • Concentrate on similarities. Contact people who may already have some business background related to your product. Take advantage of face-to-face opportunities. Spend time looking for professionals who share similar health interests—neighbors, PTA members, coworkers, holistic/natural health professionals, chiropractors, spa employees, physical/massage therapists, etc.—any business you can link to your product.
  • Focus on people you’ve met through classes. These people are more familiar with you and the products already, and they often transition from customer to builder.Encourage these people. Many people you meet through classes may likely be more prepared to start building a business than they think. Help them feel why they can be successful: They love and have been proactive in learning about the products, they actively share and promote product uses and benefits, they’re personable and sincere, they work hard, etc.
  • Advertise classes specific to the business. Teach a “business” class, and invite customers familiar with you and the products. At the class, start people with an easy model. Explain the benefits, and describe the type of work involved. Explain how to earn a little commission to simply pay for personal product use, not a full-fledged business model. This may seem less complicated and intimidating to them, and it directly supports a desire they have—more products.
  • Post job ads. Describe the type of work involved. You can also use a website or social media to make contacts and attract people interested in your type of work.
  • Attract people to the business. Attract builders by being the type of leader and by managing the type of business you would like to work with. Be confident, passionate, hardworking, honest, organized, inviting, instructive, supportive, knowledgeable, and humble. People will be drawn to you first and then the business opportunity.When people are drawn to you and your style of business and you help them recognize that they have the skills and drive to be successful, the transition from customer to business builder is much smoother.

content.rendered:
Confidence

How to Feel Confident as a Business Professional
  • Take things one step at a time. Don’t feel like you have to know everything all at once.
  • Concentrate on the good your business can do for people. The products help people. The business opportunity helps people.
  • Start with what you know, what you’re good at, and what is comfortable and exciting to you. Your excitement will spread.
    • Share with family and friends.
    • Host classes or invite friends/family to host classes for you.
    • Present products you are confident with.
    • Get creative with product uses, and share these new ways to use them on social media, blogs, newsletters, etc.
  • Contact businesses associated with your product. Businesses like medical centers, health food stores, massage therapists, beauty supply stores, etc. have things in common with your products, making it easier to talk to them and share products that way.
  • Learn from others, and practice what you see until you find your own style. Learn from webinars, conference calls, watching others, and videos on YouTube.
  • It’s okay to use recognized business strategies. Be professional and responsible. Have productive meetings. Promote yourself and your services. Create clear mission objectives. Set goals and organize strategies to accomplish them.
  • Emphasize the uniqueness of your industry. You are your own boss and responsible for growth and success. You can create your own schedule. You can work from home, and you can also receive tax deductions.

content.rendered:
Use Success Plus to personalize a strategy map to help you achieve any goal you want. This may include increasing family support, improving communication, working with your upline to improve your skills, improving your training methods, improving time management, setting better goals, increasing your motivation, etc.

Enter a name for your strategy map (for example, “Better Communication” or “More Family Support”).

STEP 1Foster Trust and Build Teamwork

Do you and your team members display a positive perspective more than you blame or complain? Are you open and transparent in describing your motives and intentions? Do you genuinely care about the members of your team, and do they understand that you are highly committed? These are good places to begin building trust.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 2Define the Direction

Make a specific goal, and set a due date. Make your goal something you feel strongly about and something you can create a specific plan to achieve, and make it the combined focus of all participating members.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 3Organize a Plan for Innovation

Organize your plan in a way that ensures you have a clear description or map to accomplish what you want to do.


Ideas


Ideas

10-Day Planner

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? Include your daily and weekly habits and steps to use the leadership innovations to make sure your strategy is effective and powerful. If your plan is successfully completed in 10 days, great! If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Ideas











STEP 4Energize Your Alliances

An energized alliance is a mutually beneficial relationship where there is clear understanding about goals, an agreed-upon schedule of performance and communication, and a strong commitment to keep promises and fulfill expectations.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 5Build Capacity

Success will depend on whether you and your team have the abilities and motivation to actually do what you need to do. If you need to do something but currently don’t have the necessary skills, learn how, and celebrate this new skill by putting it to use.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 6Measure Progress and Render an Account

When you set up times to evaluate and report on your progress, you are demonstrating commitment to it. Are you willing to share your successes with others and ask for help when you are not being successful?


Ideas


Ideas

Coaching

After you complete your goals, review your strategy map and report your results. Be accountable to your plan. Make each strategy better by measuring progress, identifying a better method, and making adjustments. You can do this. Now go to work!

content.rendered:
Finding people with leadership potential and preparing them to be strong leaders is the foundation of growth for your business. One of the most successful ways to find those with leadership skills is to implement the leadership and innovation practices described in the Catalyst Leadership System. Watch how people apply these practices. Those who work to apply them are likely filled with leadership potential.

Use Success Plus to create strong leaders. Possible goals might include showing leaders how to create better strategies, teaching them to be more self-reliant, or helping them train their team in leadership.

STEP 1Foster Trust and Build Teamwork

Trust is the engine that makes cooperative leadership work. Identify those individuals who seem more distant or less responsive, and do what is necessary to create trust. When it comes to building strong leaders, you will need trust to form a mentoring relationship, get a high degree of performance, motivate people, and carry out reporting methods.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 2Define Your Direction

Defining direction is imagining something you want and then giving it life by making it the combined focus of all team members. Make a specific goal, and set a due date. Make your goal achievable, something you feel strongly about, and something you can create a specific plan to achieve.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 3Organize a Plan for Innovation

Organize your plan in a way that invites every team member to understand it and agree with it. Understanding the plan and agreeing with it will lead to increased commitment to carry it out.


Ideas


Ideas

10-Day Planner

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? Include your daily and weekly habits and steps to use the leadership innovations to make sure your strategy is effective and powerful. If your plan is successfully completed in 10 days, great! If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Ideas











An energized alliance is a relationship where there is clear understanding about goals, an agreed-upon schedule of performance and communication, and a strong commitment to keep promises and fulfill expectations.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 5Build Capacity

Success will depend on whether you and your team have the abilities and motivation to actually do what you need to do—or be willing to develop new abilities so everyone has more capacity than they currently have.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 6Measure Progress and Render an Account

Measuring performance makes it possible to improve performance. Rendering an account makes it likely that people will actually follow through. This combination is what creates substantial improvement.

Measure Progress

You can measure your success at creating strong leaders in a variety of ways: measure how much volume they share, the number of builders who hit rank, and the number of new builders on their teams. Remember, the more diligently you record the results, the more precisely you can measure whether your strategy is working—and the faster you’ll see success!

Discovery Questions


Ideas

Render an Account

When each person reports on his or her assignments, they are demonstrating loyalty and commitment. When these reports are positive and understood by other team members, there is a growing consensus that each person is committed and the work of innovation will be successful.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

Coaching

After you complete your goals, review your strategy map and report your results. Be accountable to your plan. Make each strategy better by measuring progress, identifying a better method, and making adjustments. You can do this. Now go to work!

content.rendered:
Possible goals might include becoming more effective at helping people with the product, improving classes, using written materials more efficiently, helping your downline improve their teaching skills, improving product sharing opportunities, or more efficiently connecting product knowledge to desired outcomes so effort feels relevant.

STEP 1Foster Trust and Build Teamwork

The products you are sharing are central to your business. The more you’re willing to learn, the more applications you can make to those you teach. When you can teach successfully, your ability to influence people to use, buy, and share these products will increase. All of this requires that people trust you.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 2Define the Direction

How much time you devote to regularly learning more about the products, teaching, and the business basics is one of the factors that determines your success. Your commitment to this begins with taking the time to define a clear-cut direction, which includes goals you want to achieve to improve over past performance.

Make a specific goal, and set a due date. Choose something you can succeed at so you start off with a good track record. Make your goal something you feel strongly about and something you can create a specific plan to achieve.

Discovery Questions


Ideas


Ideas

STEP 3Organize a Plan for Innovation

Make certain your strategy to improve product knowledge and teaching is clear, small enough to be completed, and simple enough to be effective. Plan well and exceed your expectations. Organize your plan in a way that invites every team member to understand it and agree with it. Don’t hesitate to include your leaders in coming up with the plan!

Discovery Questions


Ideas


Ideas

10-Day Planner

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? Include your daily and weekly habits and steps to use the leadership innovations to make sure your strategy is effective and powerful. If your plan is successfully completed in 10 days, great! If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Ideas











STEP 4Energize Your Alliances

An energized alliance is a relationship where each person has a clear understanding of goals, an agreed-upon schedule of performance and communication, and a strong commitment to keep promises and fulfill expectations so both parties benefit. Energizing alliances may be the most crucial business skill.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 5Build Capacity

Success will depend on whether you and your team have the abilities and motivation to continually learn about products and teaching. This will provide you with a fairly steady source of new ideas and will not only motivate your team to learn new things but will add confidence and improve volume and loyalty enrollments.

Discovery Questions


Ideas


Ideas

STEP 6Measure Progress and Render an Account

Measure Progress

One way to assess your progress with improving product knowledge and teaching is by measuring the success of your classes. Classes are where you exhibit the knowledge you possess, and your success at teaching leads to sharing, enrollments, and additional classes.

Ideas

Render an Account

Discovery Questions

content.rendered:
Possible goals to hit rank faster might include strategically placing people, organizing a team approach to motivate everyone to hit rank faster, improving training programs where rank is emphasized, developing a specific strategy for increasing everyone’s rank, or setting specific goals to achieve greater volume and enroll more people.

STEP 1Foster Trust and Build Teamwork

Hitting new ranks, of course, is everyone’s measure of growth and prosperity in this business. It also means that you are helping others be successful. A trust-building approach based on your intention to help others is typically much more successful than being demanding, micromanaging, or applying too much pressure. This is because a trust-building approach shows people you truly care about what’s important to them. And this high-level relationship is a powerful catalyst to hit rank faster.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 2
Define the Direction

Define direction by imagining an outcome you want and then giving it life by making it your focus and the focus of all team members. Make your goal something achievable, something you feel strongly about, and something you can create a specific plan to achieve. Select a due date, and schedule it on your calendar.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 3Organize a Plan for Innovation

If you do not plan well, then you’re likely planning to fail. Take the time to plan out a strategy that will make hitting your next rank a real possibility. This “strategic thinking” is a core performance skill and is often the difference between those who succeed and those who don’t.

Discovery Questions



Ideas


Ideas

10-Day Planner

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? Include your daily and weekly habits and steps to use the leadership innovations to make sure your strategy is effective and powerful. If your plan is successfully completed in 10 days, great! If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Ideas











STEP 4Energize Your Alliances

When it comes to hitting rank faster, the need for skillful cooperation is self-evident because you can only hit rank faster when others do too. Knowing how to energize alliances is a powerful leadership tool and ensures that everyone on your team contributes and feels satisfied.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 5Build Capacity

Things change over time, and in order to keep pace or be ahead of the game, you will need to spend some of your time learning new skills that make hitting rank faster more likely.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 6Measure Progress and Render an Account

Improve performance by setting a schedule to measure progress along the way, instead of just measuring results at the end.

Measure Progress

Discovery Questions


Ideas

Render an Account

Discovery Questions


Ideas

Coaching

After you complete your goals, review your strategy map and report your results. Be accountable to your plan. Make each strategy better by measuring progress, identifying a better method, and making adjustments. You can do this. Now go to work!

Making sure trust exists and everyone feels a strong sense of teamwork may be one of the strongest motivational tools.

Ideas

Defining direction is imagining an outcome you want and then giving it life by making it your focus and the focus of all team members. Boosting leader motivation can be observed through their improved attitudes, an increased number of self-initiated activities, and increased productivity and growth.

Make a specific goal, and set a due date. Choose something you can succeed at so you start off with a good track record. Make your goal something you feel strongly about and something you can create a specific plan to achieve.

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Forming alliances with your leaders and creating team unity is one of the most effective ways of motivating everyone to improve. Boosting leader motivation likely requires commitment to change behavior—yours and theirs. Have you committed yourself? Have you asked others to commit to becoming more diligent and motivated, and did they agree?

content.rendered:
Possible goals might include increasing teaching or sharing opportunities, improving your ability to promote teamwork, closing sales more successfully, finding more retail customers, obtaining more referrals, providing better service, or using customer follow up to increase repeat sales.

STEP 1Foster Trust and Build Teamwork

One reason people don’t keep promises or they perform below their potential is a lack of trust. When you lack motivation, sometimes it’s because you don’t trust yourself. Trust is essential!

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 2Define the Direction

Success starts by defining the direction or picking a target you want to hit. Be creative, and then give your direction life by making it your focus and the focus of all team members! Make a specific goal, and set a due date. Choose something you can succeed at but also something that challenges you.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 3Create a Plan for Innovation

Now create the step-by-step plan or strategy you’ll use to achieve your desired outcome. There are three primary parts to a strong plan: 1) tasks that are essential for the plan to work (Critical Success Factors), 2) consideration of time, money (budget), and frequency and type of communication, and 3) people who are essential or will help the plan succeed.

Discovery Questions


Ideas


Ideas

10-Day Planner

Create your plan by scheduling out the next 10 work days. What will you do each day to work toward your goal? Include your daily and weekly habits and steps to use the leadership innovations to make sure your strategy is effective and powerful. If your plan is successfully completed in 10 days, great! If not, schedule the next 10 days until the strategy is successful.

Ideas











STEP 4Energize Your Alliances

Many people in your downline will discover more motivation when they feel increased mutual commitment among the team. People you share with will invest more when they believe they are part of a common, unified cause.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

STEP 5Build Capacity

People fail to act when they do not know what to do or feel unprepared. Learning new skills and knowledge boosts confidence and activates a desire to perform and efforts to help other people benefit.

Discovery Questions



Ideas

STEP 6Measure Progress and Render an Account

Performance that is measured is performance that improves. Performance that is measured and reported is performance that improves the most!

Discovery Questions

Your chances for increasing volume are greater if you record volume from three categories each week:

  • new enrollments,
  • customers who purchase regularly (we call these “existing customers”), and
  • volume for the team or leg you are tracking.

Remember, the more diligently you record the results, the more precisely you can measure whether your strategy is successful!



Ideas

Render an Account

You are more likely to achieve your goals if you set due dates and plan to render an account of your progress to someone in your upline. You will also improve your team volume if you invite members of your team to regularly render an account to you. Suggest times when they can report their progress. Make it fun by offering incentives or prizes, or even turn it into a friendly competition.

Discovery Questions


Ideas

DUE DATE

Set a due date for your project, and watch your success increase as you complete tasks by the deadline. Then start again on another goal.

Coaching

After you complete your goals, review your strategy map and report your results. Be accountable to your plan. Make each strategy better by measuring progress, identifying a better method, and making adjustments. You can do this. Now go to work!

content.rendered:
PROJECT PLANNER AND IDEA CENTER

Goal Templates

  • Increase Volume
  • Boost Leader Motivation
  • Hit Rank Faster
  • Improve Product Knowledge and Teaching
  • Enroll More People
  • Create Strong Leaders
  • Customize Your Goal

Welcome!
Have you ever worked really hard on a project and things didn’t turn out as you’d hoped? The solution is in the strategy. Strategies are how entrepreneurs like you succeed because they allow you to work more efficiently—spending time on what really works and produces for your business—so you experience less frustration and burnout and more success.

Success Plus is an innovative project planner and idea center that helps you increase success and eliminate stress and frustration by creating, sharing, and finding successful strategies. You’ll find hundreds of new ideas and see how to organize effective strategies that get you over fears and performance humps and allow you to put YOUR ideas into action.

Success Plus helps you create an organized, directed, and effective plan called a strategy map. It will take you through each step of the strategic process, using the leadership innovations in the Catalyst Leadership System. These six principles are the natural conditions necessary to improve performance and develop leadership in any team and industry. They are the catalyst for change. When problems in performance or teamwork exist, it’s because one or more of these conditions is missing or underdeveloped. The strategy maps in Success Plus will help you master these six principles.

Succeed faster by sharing! Success Plus even allows you to share the strategies you’ve created and find strategies other successful leaders use so everyone succeeds faster and more often.

Icons
NOTE: We need icons designed for this training. The following icons are suggestions. (Coaching icon from CLS could work here too.)

Discovery Questions
Questions designed to spark ideas and narrow your focus.

Coaching
Get better results and resolve problems faster with the help of a 6i Catalyst coach from 6innovations.com.

To Do
Once you set a goal, you can review your action items in the “To Do” section found on the main menu. Once you complete a goal, tap on it in the “To Do” section, then click “Done.” The more goals you complete, the more rewards you earn! And don’t forget to share the excitement with your team.

How to Create Strategy Maps
Select from the goal templates listed in the menu to create strategies for six essential goals to build your business, and then follow the on-screen instructions.

Or, to create a unique strategy for your own specific goal, select “Customize Your Goal.”

content.rendered: Find the right people, and activate the freedom to choose. Good leaders are good at finding the right people to perform certain tasks. Even though some people may resist freedom and the responsibility that comes with it, people who are right for any position will achieve more and sustain their performance better when their freedom is activated by those who lead them. Leaders who wisely activate the freedom to choose use the inviting words “will you” rather than telling people “you will.”

content.rendered:
How to Get People to a Class
James wanted to make his classes more effective. He applied the principles of creating a plan for innovation to see where he could make improvements.

  1. He identified his Critical Success Factors as sending out invitations, scheduling with the host and the presenter so the class was ready, and making sure he sent reminders.
  2. He made sure to organize The Vital Few Resources: time (his own and how much would be required by presenters), money (free gifts to those who bring a friend, raffle tickets for drawings, handouts, name tags, etc.), and communication (involving the consultants who help answer questions at the end of the class).
  3. James had seen only modest attendance at previous classes, so he wanted to try something new to see if he could improve. He decided to lay out a Change Path and put it in motion. He sent out forty invitations as he had done before, but this time he sent them two weeks earlier. Then at one week before and again two days before the class, he sent out a reminder text or email. These reminders included information about exciting drawings, new products, and requests for questions about health needs to create interest and to help him come better prepared to help people.
  4. James recognized his allies as the host and presenter and made sure they were comfortable, accommodated, and helped in any way.

James was able to not only increase the number in attendance, but he was also able to provide more helpful information. Because of this, he shared more product, and a higher percentage of people from his classes decided to enroll.

content.rendered:
People often become frustrated when they try to do too much alone and are not using their allies like upline or crossline leaders and family. No one succeeds on their own!

If you feel increased stress because you are torn between building a business and caring for your family, help yourself and your family by allocating time for your family and personal relationships.Schedule time with your family (i.e., “I want to spend this much time playing games” or “I want to spend this much time together on weekends”). If your family is at peace, you will be happier. And a happier person is a more effective business leader!

content.rendered: If you find yourself becoming frustrated when you talk to others (e.g., new contacts, enrollments, or downline builders) and you’re not getting anywhere, you may need to take a moment to work on trust: observe the situation (what’s going on?), question or explore possible reasons why (is it communication type or frequency?), and then identify any associations between how you are talking with people and why they had that response to you (i.e., “When I communicate this way, they are impatient. I need to change how I communicate or how often I communicate so communication is more in line with what these people want.”).
